name: integral_mul_fderiv_eq_neg_fderiv_mul_of_integrable
declaration:
/-- **Integration by parts for FrÃ©chet derivatives**
Version with two scalar functions: `âˆ« f * g' = - âˆ« f' * g` when `f * g'` and `f' * g` and `f * g`
are integrable, where `f'` and `g'` are the derivatives of `f` and `g` in a given direction `v`. -/
theorem integral_mul_fderiv_eq_neg_fderiv_mul_of_integrable {E : Type u_1} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E] [MeasurableSpace E] [BorelSpace E] {Î¼ : MeasureTheory.Measure E} [FiniteDimensional â„ E] [MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddHaarMeasure Î¼] {ğ•œ : Type u_5} [NormedField ğ•œ] [NormedAlgebra â„ ğ•œ] {f : E â†’ ğ•œ} {g : E â†’ ğ•œ} {v : E} (hf'g : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => (fderiv â„ f x) v * g x) Î¼) (hfg' : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => f x * (fderiv â„ g x) v) Î¼) (hfg : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => f x * g x) Î¼) (hf : Differentiable â„ f) (hg : Differentiable â„ g) : âˆ« (x : E), f x * (fderiv â„ g x) v âˆ‚Î¼ = -âˆ« (x : E), (fderiv â„ f x) v * g x âˆ‚Î¼

name: integral_bilinear_hasLineDerivAt_right_eq_neg_left_of_integrable
declaration:
/-- **Integration by parts for line derivatives**
Version with a general bilinear form `B`.
If `B f g` is integrable, as well as `B f' g` and `B f g'` where `f'` and `g'` are derivatives
of `f` and `g` in a given direction `v`, then `âˆ« B f g' = - âˆ« B f' g`. -/
theorem integral_bilinear_hasLineDerivAt_right_eq_neg_left_of_integrable {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} {G : Type u_3} {W : Type u_4} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E] [NormedAddCommGroup F] [NormedSpace â„ F] [NormedAddCommGroup G] [NormedSpace â„ G] [NormedAddCommGroup W] [NormedSpace â„ W] [MeasurableSpace E] [BorelSpace E] {Î¼ : MeasureTheory.Measure E} [FiniteDimensional â„ E] [MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddHaarMeasure Î¼] {f : E â†’ F} {f' : E â†’ F} {g : E â†’ G} {g' : E â†’ G} {v : E} {B : F â†’L[â„] G â†’L[â„] W} (hf'g : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => (B (f' x)) (g x)) Î¼) (hfg' : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => (B (f x)) (g' x)) Î¼) (hfg : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => (B (f x)) (g x)) Î¼) (hf : âˆ€ (x : E), HasLineDerivAt â„ f (f' x) x v) (hg : âˆ€ (x : E), HasLineDerivAt â„ g (g' x) x v) : âˆ« (x : E), (B (f x)) (g' x) âˆ‚Î¼ = -âˆ« (x : E), (B (f' x)) (g x) âˆ‚Î¼

name: integral_smul_fderiv_eq_neg_fderiv_smul_of_integrable
declaration:
/-- **Integration by parts for FrÃ©chet derivatives**
Version with a scalar function: `âˆ« f â€¢ g' = - âˆ« f' â€¢ g` when `f â€¢ g'` and `f' â€¢ g` and `f â€¢ g`
are integrable, where `f'` and `g'` are the derivatives of `f` and `g` in a given direction `v`. -/
theorem integral_smul_fderiv_eq_neg_fderiv_smul_of_integrable {E : Type u_1} {G : Type u_3} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E] [NormedAddCommGroup G] [NormedSpace â„ G] [MeasurableSpace E] [BorelSpace E] {Î¼ : MeasureTheory.Measure E} [FiniteDimensional â„ E] [MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddHaarMeasure Î¼] {ğ•œ : Type u_5} [NormedField ğ•œ] [NormedAlgebra â„ ğ•œ] [NormedSpace ğ•œ G] [IsScalarTower â„ ğ•œ G] {f : E â†’ ğ•œ} {g : E â†’ G} {v : E} (hf'g : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => (fderiv â„ f x) v â€¢ g x) Î¼) (hfg' : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => f x â€¢ (fderiv â„ g x) v) Î¼) (hfg : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => f x â€¢ g x) Î¼) (hf : Differentiable â„ f) (hg : Differentiable â„ g) : âˆ« (x : E), f x â€¢ (fderiv â„ g x) v âˆ‚Î¼ = -âˆ« (x : E), (fderiv â„ f x) v â€¢ g x âˆ‚Î¼

name: integral_bilinear_hasFDerivAt_right_eq_neg_left_of_integrable
declaration:
/-- **Integration by parts for FrÃ©chet derivatives**
Version with a general bilinear form `B`.
If `B f g` is integrable, as well as `B f' g` and `B f g'` where `f'` and `g'` are derivatives
of `f` and `g` in a given direction `v`, then `âˆ« B f g' = - âˆ« B f' g`. -/
theorem integral_bilinear_hasFDerivAt_right_eq_neg_left_of_integrable {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} {G : Type u_3} {W : Type u_4} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E] [NormedAddCommGroup F] [NormedSpace â„ F] [NormedAddCommGroup G] [NormedSpace â„ G] [NormedAddCommGroup W] [NormedSpace â„ W] [MeasurableSpace E] [BorelSpace E] {Î¼ : MeasureTheory.Measure E} [FiniteDimensional â„ E] [MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddHaarMeasure Î¼] {f : E â†’ F} {f' : E â†’ E â†’L[â„] F} {g : E â†’ G} {g' : E â†’ E â†’L[â„] G} {v : E} {B : F â†’L[â„] G â†’L[â„] W} (hf'g : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => (B ((f' x) v)) (g x)) Î¼) (hfg' : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => (B (f x)) ((g' x) v)) Î¼) (hfg : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => (B (f x)) (g x)) Î¼) (hf : âˆ€ (x : E), HasFDerivAt f (f' x) x) (hg : âˆ€ (x : E), HasFDerivAt g (g' x) x) : âˆ« (x : E), (B (f x)) ((g' x) v) âˆ‚Î¼ = -âˆ« (x : E), (B ((f' x) v)) (g x) âˆ‚Î¼

name: integral_bilinear_fderiv_right_eq_neg_left_of_integrable
declaration:
/-- **Integration by parts for FrÃ©chet derivatives**
Version with a general bilinear form `B`.
If `B f g` is integrable, as well as `B f' g` and `B f g'` where `f'` and `g'` are the derivatives
of `f` and `g` in a given direction `v`, then `âˆ« B f g' = - âˆ« B f' g`. -/
theorem integral_bilinear_fderiv_right_eq_neg_left_of_integrable {E : Type u_1} {F : Type u_2} {G : Type u_3} {W : Type u_4} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E] [NormedAddCommGroup F] [NormedSpace â„ F] [NormedAddCommGroup G] [NormedSpace â„ G] [NormedAddCommGroup W] [NormedSpace â„ W] [MeasurableSpace E] [BorelSpace E] {Î¼ : MeasureTheory.Measure E} [FiniteDimensional â„ E] [MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddHaarMeasure Î¼] {f : E â†’ F} {g : E â†’ G} {v : E} {B : F â†’L[â„] G â†’L[â„] W} (hf'g : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => (B ((fderiv â„ f x) v)) (g x)) Î¼) (hfg' : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => (B (f x)) ((fderiv â„ g x) v)) Î¼) (hfg : MeasureTheory.Integrable (fun x => (B (f x)) (g x)) Î¼) (hf : Differentiable â„ f) (hg : Differentiable â„ g) : âˆ« (x : E), (B (f x)) ((fderiv â„ g x) v) âˆ‚Î¼ = -âˆ« (x : E), (B ((fderiv â„ f x) v)) (g x) âˆ‚Î¼
